pgmcomponents.gui.gui_widgets¶

gui_widgets.py

Provides a set of widgets for use in the GUI.

Author: Patrick Wang Email: patrick.wang@diamond.ac.uk Date: 2023-10-05 Version = 0.4.1

class pgmcomponents.gui.gui_widgets.EPICScontrol(name: str, value: float, increments: float, key: str, pgm=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A EPICS like control widget.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the control.

  • value (float) – The default value of the control

  • increments (float) – The default increment value of the control.

  • key (str) – The key of the control.

  • pgm (PGM) – The PGM object.

up(window)[source]¶

Add increment to value

down(window)[source]¶

Subtract increment from value

update(window)[source]¶

Update the displayed value of the control.

write(window, value, pgm)[source]¶

Write a value to the control.

up(window: PySimpleGUI.Window, values: dict, pgm: pgmcomponents.elements.PGM) → None[source]¶
Parameters:

  • window (PySimpleGUI.Window) – The window object containing the control.

  • values (dict) – The values of the window.

  • pgm (PGM) – The PGM object.

Returns:

  • None

  • Add increment to value, needs the window object to update the value.

down(window: PySimpleGUI.Window, values: dict, pgm: pgmcomponents.elements.PGM) → None[source]¶

Subtract the increment value from the current value of the widget. If the widget is an order widget, the current value is converted to an integer before subtraction. The updated value is then set as the new value of the widget and also updated in the corresponding attribute of the pgm object.

Parameters:

  • window (PySimpleGUI.Window) – The window object containing the control.

  • values (dict) – The values of the window.

  • pgm (PGM20) – The PGM object.

update(window: PySimpleGUI.Window, pgm: pgmcomponents.elements.PGM) → None[source]¶

Update the value of the control.

Parameters:

  • window (The window object containing the control.) –

  • pgm (The program object containing the property to be updated.) –

Return type:

None

write(window: PySimpleGUI.Window, value: dict, pgm: pgmcomponents.elements.PGM) → None[source]¶

Subroutine to write the values of a known pgm to the window.

Parameters:

  • window (PySimpleGUI.Window) – The main window.

  • value (float) – The value to write to the control.

  • pgm (PGM) – The PGM object.

update_inc(window: PySimpleGUI.Window) → None[source]¶

Update the increment of the control.

Parameters:

window (PySimpleGUI.Window) – The window object containing the control.

pgmcomponents.gui.gui_widgets.configuration_popup(title: str, key: str, element: pgmcomponents.elements.Plane_Mirror | pgmcomponents.elements.Grating, window) → dict[source]¶

Creates a popup window for configuration of Plane_Mirror or Grating.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the popup window.

  • key (str) – The key of the element.

  • element (Plane_Mirror or Grating) – The element to configure. Either ‘Plane_Mirror’ or ‘Grating’.

Returns:

values – A dictionary of values for the element.

Return type:

dict

class pgmcomponents.gui.gui_widgets.Beam_Config[source]¶

Bases: object

Provides a class for beam configuration.

electron_size_h¶

The electron horizontal size RMS.

Type:

float

electron_size_v¶

The electron vertical size RMS.

Type:

float

electron_div_h¶

The electron horizontal divergence RMS.

Type:

float

electron_div_v¶

The electron vertical divergence RMS.

Type:

float

id_length¶

The length of the insertion device.

Type:

float

distance¶

The distance from the insertion device to the image plane.

Type:

float

num_of_sigmas¶

The number of sigmas to include in the beam size calculation.

Type:

float

beam_size_h¶

The horizontal beam size.

Type:

float

beam_size_v¶

The vertical beam size.

Type:

float

Pops up a window for beam configuration.

  • pgm (PGM) – The PGM object.

class pgmcomponents.gui.gui_widgets.OffsetsControl(values, key)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to provide the offsets control widget.

values¶

The default values of the control. keys: ‘beam_vertical’, ‘mirror_hoffset’, ‘mirror_voffset’, ‘mirror_axis_hoffset’, ‘mirror_axis_voffset’

Type:

dict

key¶

The key of the control.

Type:

str

update(window, pgm)¶
property calculate¶
updatepgm(window, pgm)[source]¶

Update the values of the PGM object.

calcoffsets(window, pgm)[source]¶

Calculate the offsets.

write(window, values, calcq=True)[source]¶

Write values to the control.

pgmcomponents.gui.gui_widgets.update_and_draw(window, pgm, values, topview_widget, sideview_widget, energy_control, cff_control, order_control, line_density_control, offsets_control)[source]¶

Update the values of the PGM object and draw the topview and sideview widgets.

Parameters:

  • window (PySimpleGUI.Window) – The main window.

  • pgm (PGM) – The PGM object.

  • values (dict) – The values of the controls.

  • topview_widget (Topview_Widget) – The topview widget.

  • sideview_widget (Sideview_Widget) – The sideview widget.

  • energy_control (EPICScontrol) – The energy control.

  • cff_control (EPICScontrol) – The cff control.

  • order_control (EPICScontrol) – The order control.

  • line_density_control (EPICScontrol) – The line density control.

pgmcomponents.gui.gui_widgets.initial_draw(window: PySimpleGUI.Window, pgm: pgmcomponents.elements.PGM, topview_widget: Topview_Widget, sideview_widget: Sideview_Widget, offsets_control: OffsetsControl) → None[source]¶

Draw the topview and sideview widgets.

Parameters:

  • window (PySimpleGUI.Window) – The main window.

  • pgm (PGM) – The PGM object.

  • topview_widget (Topview_Widget) – The topview widget.

  • sideview_widget (Sideview_Widget) – The sideview widget.

  • offsets_control (OffsetsControl) – The offsets control widget.
